content:
• Friday, January 4, 2019
  • PCG

    PG&E mulls bankruptcy - Reuters

    • PG&E (NYSE:PCG) -26.2% after-hours following a Reuters report that it is considering filing for bankruptcy protection for some or all of its businesses, as it faces billions of dollars in potential liabilities related to California wildfires in 2017-18.
    • PG&E is exploring the move as a contingency, in part because it could take a significant Q4 financial charge related to liabilities from the catastrophic fires, according to the report.
    • A bankruptcy filing reportedly is not PG&E's preference for addressing the liabilities, but the preparations could put pressure on California politicians hoping the company can avoid such an outcome.
    • Edison International (NYSE:EIX), suffering its own strains from fires in the state, -5.8% after-hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM | 244 Comments
  • SDT

    SandRidge Mississippian trusts get NYSE continued listing standards notice

    • SandRidge Mississippian Trust I (NYSE:SDT) and SandRidge Mississippian Trust II (NYSE:SDR) say they received notice from the NYSE regarding their continued listing status (I, II).
    • The Trusts say they can avoid delisting if, during the six-month period following receipt of the NYSE notice, on the last trading-day of any calendar month, their shares have a closing price and 30 trading-day average closing price of at least $1.00.
    • SDT and SDR say they do not plan a reverse split of the units or other action in an effort to affect the trading price.
    • SDT +4.4%, SDR -2.6% after-hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM | 13 Comments
  • NTRA

    PETX, ZAGG, IRWD and INSM among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: NTRA +38.8%. INSM +22.5%. PETX +9%. AKBA +6.8%. ZAGG +4.1%.
    • Top Losers: IRWD -10.2%. RGNX -9.8%. SGRY -9.7%. ANGO -9.7%. CDNA -9.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM | 4 Comments
  • GTN

    Gray Television ends sales representation deals at Raycom stations

    • With its $3.6B acquisition of Raycom complete, Gray Television (NYSE:GTN) is terminating national ad sales representation contracts covering the involved stations.
    • Beginning Feb. 25, the former Raycom stations will join legacy Gray stations in handling all business directly with buyers, the company says.
    • "For the past few years, Gray’s legacy television stations have successfully managed national advertising sales directly with national buyers, just as these stations have always dealt directly with their local and regional clients," Gray says.
    • “Raycom Media has had a long and mutually beneficial relationship with Cox Reps," says co-CEO Pat LaPlatney, who joined via the acquisition. "We nevertheless believe that Gray has the systems and experience that will allow the former Raycom stations to take national sales in-house in a manner that will make those transactions more efficient for all parties."
    • Gray's taking on termination fees of $27.6M to be reflected in Q1 broadcast expenses; it believes average annual expense savings will be $11M.
    • GTN is 3.4% lower after hours; it closed up 3.5% during the regular session.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM
  • SEM

    Select Medical issues 2019 guidance; shares -5%

    • Long-term hospital operator Select Medical Holdings (NYSE:SEM) is 5% lower in postmarket trading after announcing 2019 guidance.
    • It expects full-year net operating revenues of $5.2B-$5.4B, vs. consensus for $5.32B, along with EBITDA of $660M-$700M.
    • It's forecasting fully diluted income per common share for the year of $0.97-$1.13. Consensus of eight analysts has the company drawing EPS of $1.26 for the year.
    • #JPM19
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin off 7% after hours on soft 2019 outlook for Vascepa

    • Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) is down 7% after hours on the heels of its announcement of preliminary 2018 results and 2019 forecast, information that will be presented next week at JPM19.
    • Vascepa (icosapent ethyl) sales in Q4 2018 were $72M - 76M, above consensus of $69.4M. 2018 sales were $224M - 228M, above consensus of $221.4M.
    • Its outlook for 2019 is ~$350M, below consensus of $417.5M. It does not expect managed care coverage to change much from last year.
    • The company plans to file a supplemental marketing application in the U.S. seeking approval for a cardioprotective claim for Vascepa this quarter. It does not expect the new indication, if approved, to impact its 2019 forecast.
    • It plans to spend an additional $50M - 75M this year to purchase additional inventory of product to support a revenue rate of ~$700M this year.
    • Salesforce now numbers 400, up from 150 last year.
    • #JPM19
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 111 Comments
  • INSM

    Insmed up 17% after hours on Arikayce update

    • Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM) is up 17% after hours on the heels of its update on the U.S. commercial launch of ARIKAYCE (amikacin liposome inhalation suspension), information that will be presented at JPM19 next Wednesday, January 9.
    • On a preliminary basis, Q4 sales were ~$9.8M. Final results will be released on Friday, February 22.
    • It expects to complete the design and protocol in H1 for a confirmatory study to support full U.S. approval of ARIKAYCE for first-line Mycobacterium avium complex (MAC) lung disease. The FDA approved the product in September 2018 under its Limited Population Pathway for Antibacterial and Antifungal Drugs.
    • Marketing applications will be filed in Europe mid-year and Japan in H1 2020.
    • Enrollment in a Phase 2 clinical trial, WILLOW, evaluating INS1007 in non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis should be completed mid-year.
    • #JPM19
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 4 Comments
  • RGLS

    Regulus up 8% after hours on positive preclinical data on RGLS4326

    • Nano cap Regulus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RGLS) is up 8% after hours in response to its announcement of positive results from a new mouse toxicity study of RGLS4326, a candidate for autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD).
    • After 13 weeks of dosing, no adverse events or other significant findings were observed across all doses tested. The company plans to restart a Phase 1 trial.
    • Last summer, it suspended the Phase 1 after seeing "unexpected observations" in the first mouse study that was being conducted in parallel. The company believes the unexpected results were due to technical issues at the contract research organization running the study.
    • RGLS4326 is a novel oligonucleotide that the company says preferentially targets the kidney by inhibiting an RNA gene called miR-17.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • GE

    Report: Apollo considering bid for GE's jet leasing business

    • General Electric (NYSE:GE) +2.7% after-hours on headlines that Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO) is considering making a bid for the company's jet leasing business, which is said to be worth as much as $40B.
    • Bloomberg reports APO has met with lenders to secure ~$30B in financing to purchase all or part of GE Capital Aviation Services, as potential buyers circle one of GE’s crown jewels.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 193 Comments
  • PCG

    PG&E seeking board changes, reviewing structural options

    • PG&E (PCG +1.9%) says it is conducting a "board refreshment process" that includes a search for new directors at its holding company and its Pacific Gas and Electric utility subsidiary.
    • The company says it is working with a leading search firm to identify new directors and is currently interviewing several candidates.
    • PG&E says it reviewing structural options to best position it to implement necessary changes while meeting customer and operational needs, in the wake of November's deadly wildfires in northern California.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 3 Comments
  • SHLDQ

    CNBC: Lampert’s bid to save Sears appears to come up short

    • Sears (OTCPK:SHLDQ -13.3%) believes Eddie Lampert's last-ditch bid to save the company has fallen short, CNBC reports.
    • Lampert’s $4.4B offer through his ESL Investments hedge fund is the only bid that could keep Sears going in its entirety; without a deal, the company could liquidate.
    • Sears' advisors have until 4:00 p.m. ET today to decide whether Lampert’s bid is viable.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 108 Comments
  • RCUS

    Arcus Bio down 14% on COO departure

    • Thinly traded micro cap Arcus Biosciences (RCUS -13.9%) is down on almost double normal, albeit on turnover of only 439K shares, in response to the announced exit of COO and CFO Jennifer Jarrett to "pursue an opportunity" at a transportation and technology company. She plans to depart on January 11 but has agreed to serve in a consulting role to ensure a smooth transition.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • CTWS

    Connecticut Water, SJW lose bid to reopen review of proposed merger

    • Connecticut Water (CTWS -4.4%) sinks after its request to reopen the review of its proposed $1.1B buyout by California's SJW Group (SJW +2.4%) is denied by the Connecticut Public Utilities Regulatory Authority.
    • The companies last month had offered various new commitments to state regulators, who had preliminarily denied the proposed combination.
    • Eversource Energy (ES +0.6%), a spurned suitor in last year’s bidding war for CTWS, had urged state regulators to stand by their preliminary rejection.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • AAPL

    Trump: Not worried about Apple stock; company should build in U.S.

    • President Trump's latest interchange with reporters included new stock commentary, on news dominating the tech sector this week: He's not worried about a drop in Apple's (AAPL +3.7%) stock price.
    • "They've gone up hundreds of percent since I'm president," he says. "Apple was at a number that was incredible and they're gonna be fine; Apple is a great company." (Apple shares are up 26.7% since Trump's inauguration, adjusting for dividends and splits.)
    • He is calling for them to move manufacturing to the U.S., however.
    • "Don't forget this: Apple makes their product in China," he says. "I told [CEO] Tim Cook ... make your product in the United States. Build those big beautiful plants that go on for miles, it seems.
    • "China is the biggest beneficiary of Apple, more than us ... I want Apple to make their iPhones and all of the great things that they make in the United States, and that'll take place."
    • Previously: Apple cuts Q1 revenue guidance (Jan. 02 2019)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 389 Comments

  • Big day for emerging markets

    • U.S. stocks were already set for a strong day, and then Fed Chair Jay Powell aided things by suggesting the central bank is ready to quickly halt its tightening phase and even begin easing, if necessary.
    • That's helped send the S&P 500 soaring 3.25% and the Nasdaq 4.1%.
    • The prospect of eased U.S. monetary policy would also be good news for roughed up emerging markets, and the iShares MSCI Emerging Markets ETF (EEM +3.3%) and Vanguard FTSE Emerging Markets (VWO +3.3%) are responding.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 6 Comments
  • HON

    Honeywell +3% after RBC, Credit Suisse upgrades

    • Honeywell (HON +3.3%) is higher after RBC Capital upgrades shares to Outperform from Sector Perform with a $148 price target, saying the spinoffs of Garrett Motion and Resideo Technologies have "bolstered earnings quality and defensive mix."
    • The re-rated company has "higher profitability, dampened cyclicality, stronger balance sheet, reduced legacy environmental/asbestos liabilities, and undivided attention on its core businesses," writes RBC's Deane Dray, who expects investors to reflect HON's shift up the "quality curve."
    • Dray also says HON has "plenty of dry powder for M&A, as [new CEO Darius Adamczyk] begins to execute his objective to transform the company to a Software-Industrial."
    • The RBC upgrade comes a day after Credit Suisse's John Walsh made HON one of his top industrial stock picks for 2019, highlighting the company’s strong balance sheet and above-average free cash flow generation.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • WISA

    Microcaps mostly among tech movers

    • Gainers: Summit Wireless Technologies (WISA) +19%. FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) +19%. GTT Communications (NYSE:GTT) +17%. Inseego (NASDAQ:INSG) +15%. BSQUARE Corporation (NASDAQ:BSQR) +14%.
    • Losers: Boxlight Corporation (NASDAQ:BOXL) -14%. Superconductor Technologies (NASDAQ:SCON) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 7 Comments
  • FB

    Reuters: Time for new captain at Facebook?

    • It's time for new leadership and even a new business model at Facebook (FB +4.2%), Reuters' Jennifer Saba argues, saying that while Chairman/CEO Mark Zuckerberg is inseparable from the social network, his lack of perspective helped create its existential problems.
    • The choice is between stemming user losses by cleaning up its controversial content/policies or looking for new revenue streams, she argues.
    • A previous challenge (in 2012, addressing doubts it could move ads to mobile phones from PCs) was solved by Zuckerberg and COO Sheryl Sandberg -- without changing the model but doubling costs.
    • If that happens now, Saba suggests, opex would hit $50B and slower revenue growth would land at $68B; after taxes, profits of $15B would value Facebook (via current multiples) at $260B, a third less than at the end of November.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 132 Comments
  • AMID

    American Midstream Partners and Key Energy Services among Energy/Materials gainers

    • Gainers: American Midstream Partners (NYSE:AMID) +27%. Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) +19%. Chaparral Energy (NYSE:CHAP) +15%. AK Steel Holding (NYSE:AKS) +13%. Lilis Energy (NYSEMKT:LLEX) +13%.
    • Losers: Eldorado Gold (NYSE:EGO) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 20 Comments
  • EXPE

    Goldman Sachs sees big bounce for Expedia

    • Goldman Sachs expects a vibrant rally for Expedia (EXPE +4.8%) this year.
    • "While we're still generally cautious on the travel space given tight supply and healthy underlying demand, we believe TripAdvisor and Booking's recent ad spend rationalization puts Expedia in a better relative position," writes analyst Heath Terry.
    • "We believe we have seen evidence of this during recent periods where Expedia was able to drive bookings growth acceleration alongside leverage in ad spend," Terry adds.
    • GS upgrades Expedia to a Buy rating from Neutral and assigns a price target of $140, just a shade above the 52-week high of $139.77.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • RHHBY

    Biotechs lead broad market advance, XBI up 5%

    • Biotech and healthcare companies are enjoying robust buying in conjunction with the broad market. The SPDR S&P Biotech ETF (XBI +5.1%) is ahead of the major indexes, albeit on below-average volume.
    • Selected tickers: (XLV +3.5%)(BIB +10.7%)(PJP +3.7%)(VHT +3.8%)(IYH +3.7%)(IBB +5.4%)(OTCQX:RHHBY +1.1%)(ABBV +3.1%)(AGN +4.7%)(AZN +2.6%)(BMY +4.9%)(MRK +3.2%)(NVS +1.8%)(BHC +5.1%)(TEVA +6.1%)(BIIB +5.2%)(AMGN +3.7%)(GILD +4.3%)(CELG +6.2%)(VRTX +5.3%)(XTLB +10.4%)(VTL +18.4%)(SNDX +16.9%)(SPHS +24.3%)(SCYX +15.2%)(RETA +12.8%)(PBYI +3.2%)(HSGX +23.9%)(FLKS +47.1%)(DRRX +26.1%)(CDTX +10.4%)(CTIC +28.8%)(BPTH +19.6%)(AKAO +44.9%)(FLGT +19%)(CRSP +10.1%)(KRYS +12.1%)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 32 Comments

  • Stocks hold onto strong gains amid jobs, Fed, trade news

    • Stocks continue their strong advance amid a blowout December jobs report, optimism on China-U.S. trade talks, and reassurance from the Fed that it's prepared to shift policy quickly if needed.
    • In early afternoon, the S&P is up 3.6%, touching its highest point in more than a week; Nasdaq +4.4% and the Dow +3.6%.
    • By sector, technology (+4.0%) and services (+4.0%) lead the pack. Utilities (+1.4%) and conglomerates (+2.0%) rise the least.
    • Notable movers include Microsoft (+5.0%), Alphabet (+4.7%), Facebook (+4.2%), and Amazon (+5.4%). Apple (+3.8%) regains some of the ground it lost on Thursday.
    • There are pockets of red in retail, specifically auto parts stores--O'Reilly Automotive (-0.8%), Autozone (-0.6%), and Advance Auto Parts (-1.0%); Macy's (-1.3%) and The Gap (-0.5%) also decline.
    • Oil gains 1.7% to $47.91/bbl, and gold slides 0.8% to $1,284.60/ounce.
    • The dollar index edges down 0.1% to 96.18.
    • 10-year Treasury falls, pushing yield up almost 12 basis points to 2.67%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 17 Comments
  • FCX

    Copper bounces as China eases reserve requirements, eyes U.S. trade talks

    • Copper prices rally from yesterday’s 18-month low after China cut bank reserve requirements and announced new trade talks with the U.S.; LME copper closed +3.2% at $5,918/metric ton.
    • “China’s easing [of reserve requirements] has managed to turn round the downtrend,” says Societe Generale's Robin Bhar. “But all this could retrace next week, depending on the trade talks. If the trade dispute escalates, this rally will be short-lived.”
    • Bhar expects industrial metals prices to rise 5%-10% in 2019 because any weakness in demand would be offset by tight supply.
    • Among major industrial metals stocks: FCX +8.3%, BHP +6.7%, RIO +6.1%, VALE +9.2%, TECK +6.5%, AA +8.2%, CENX +11.5%, CLF +10.5%, X +9.3%, AKS +12.2%, MT +8.1%, ATI +6.7%, CSTM +8.5%, SCCO +8.2%, CF +7.9%, MOS +6.9%, NTR +4.3%, SQM +5%.
    • ETFs: OTCPK:JJCTF, COPX, DBB, CPER, BOM, BDD, JJM, BOS, RJZ, UBM,
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 28 Comments
  • GNBT

    Generex up 26% on possible NuGenerex spinout

    • Thinly traded nano cap Generex Biotechnology (OTCQB:GNBT +25.9%) is up on almost double normal volume, albeit turnover of only 250K shares, following its update on developments at subsidiary NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology (formerly Antigen Express).
    • A combination trial evaluating Merck's (MRK +2.9%) Keytruda (pembrolizumab) and peptide vaccine AE37 in metastatic triple-negative breast cancer is advancing. Site selection is underway, study drugs are being packaged and the Institutional Review Board is reviewing the protocol.
    • Generex has initiated partnering discussions for co-development and collaborative R&D opportunities in I-O and immunotherapies.
    • It is also mulling a spinout of NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology after which it will operate independently with its own stock listing. Specifically, the spinout will be executed by issuing one or more dividends of NuGenerex stock to GNBT shareholders. GNBT expects to retain a controlling interest.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • OCN

    Ocwen leads financial gainers; U.S. Global Investors and Maiden Holdings among losers

    • Gainers: Ocwen Financial (NYSE:OCN) +12%. Ladenburg Thalmann Financial Services (NYSEMKT:LTS) +10%. Yirendai (NYSE:YRD) +9%. EverQuote (NASDAQ:EVER) +9%. Plymouth Industrial REIT (NYSEMKT:PLYM) +9%.
    • Losers: Maiden Holdings (NASDAQ:MHLD) -7%. Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust (NASDAQ:WHLR) -5%. U.S. Global Investors (NASDAQ:GROW) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 1 Comment

  • Big day for high-yield

    • Panic selling in stocks one day ago has turned into panic buying today, with the Dow threatening to bust 1K points higher (it's currently up 760 points). On a percentage basis, the Nasdaq is leading with a 4.25% advance.
    • That's spilling over into the roughed-up high-yield sector, with the iShares High Yield (HYG +1.6%) and the Invesco Senior Loan ETF (BKLN +1.7%) among those sporting major gains even as benchmark yields shoot higher (the 10-year Treasury is up more than 10 basis points).
    • Previously: Powell gives averages additional boost (Jan. 4)
    • ETFs: HYG, JNK, OXLC, BKLN, ECC, DHY, HIX, EAD, PHT, HYT, HYLD, JQC, PPR, ACP, ANGL, CIK, EFR, BGB, MCI, DSU, VVR, SJB, KIO, NSL, BGX, PHD
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 60 Comments
  • AKAO

    Microcaps mostly among midday movers

    • Gainers: Achaogen (NASDAQ:AKAO) +34%. AAC Holdings (NASDAQ:AAC) +32%. Titan Medical (NASDAQ:TMDI) +31%. American Midstream Partners (NYSE:AMID) +25%. PHI (NASDAQ:PHII) +23%. Sienna Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SNNA) +22%. Epizyme (NASDAQ:EPZM) +19%. EyePoint Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:EYPT) +19%. CHF Solutions (NASDAQ:CHFS) +17%. Miragen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MGEN) +17%.
    • Losers: Arcus Biosciences (NYSE:RCUS) -15%. Reebonz Holding (RBZ) -16%. Boxlight Corporation (NASDAQ:BOXL) -14%. Avadel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVDL) -10%. Regional Health Properties (NYSEMKT:RHE) -8%. Vaxart (NASDAQ:VXRT) -8%. Maiden Holdings (NASDAQ:MHLD) -8%. Esperion Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ESPR) -7%. LogicBio Therapeutics (NASDAQ:LOGC) -7%. PLx Pharma (NASDAQ:PLXP) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 6 Comments
  • LITE

    Lumentum +6.4% as analysts see Apple cut already baked in

    • Lumentum (NASDAQ:LITE) is rebounding from a slide spurred as part of Apple's revenue warnings this week, up 6.4% today with analysts largely sticking up for the stock and suggesting an overreaction.
    • Shares fell 8.4% yesterday amid a number of peers declining on the update.
    • But a heavy rebasing in November from its own guidance cut -- credited to news that Lumentum likely got from Apple -- means that Apple's update is already reflected in Lumentum's share price, a few analysts are saying.
    • Apple's announcement likely means an impact of 9-10M units, while the November reduction came out to about 15-120M units.
    • D.A. Davidson is still extremely bullish, reiterating a Buy rating with an $89 price target, implying 114% upside from today's price. Adding Oclaro will help Lumentum become far less dependent on iPhone unit sales, the firm says.
    • Northland is reiterating an Outperform with a $60 price target. Meanwhile, Needham is trimming forecasts a bit and cutting its target to $65 from $75, but sticking with a Strong Buy on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • PBR

    New Petrobras chief says no to subsidies, government intervention

    • Roberto Castello Branco, who was sworn in yesterday as the new CEO at Petrobras (PBR +2.8%), tells Bloomberg he is "revolted" by the company's moral and financial crises of recent years, and vows to raise oil production and reduce the huge debt load.
    • Criticizing the history of government interference in the company, Castello Branco says "fuel prices should be in line with international ones, with a sound 'no' to subsidies or to attempts at having a monopoly... We are pro-market economists. We like competition."
    • The new CEO also plans to continue PBR’s program of selling non-core assets and use the proceeds to cut debt and invest in promising projects.
    • But the extent to which Castello Branco will be able to put his ideas into practice is in doubt: Various courts in Brazil have suspended major PBR asset sales in recent months, the company is locked in a dispute with the government over the so-called transfer-of-rights area, and Brazil's people have consistently opposed selling off public firms in part or in whole.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • SORL

    Mattel and Orchids Paper Products among consumer gainers

    • Gainers: SORL Auto Parts (NASDAQ:SORL) +12%. China XD Plastics (NASDAQ:CXDC) +10%. Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT) +9%. Orchids Paper Products (NYSEMKT:TIS) +8%. Electrameccanica Vehicles (NASDAQ:SOLO) +8%.
    • Losers: None
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • KALV

    KalVista up 2% on pipeline update

    • Thinly traded micro cap KalVista Pharmaceuticals (KALV +1.7%) is up on light volume following its pipeline update for investors. Key points:
    • KVD900: Data from its expanded Phase 2 study in hereditary angioedema should be available in Q4. On-demand dosing in 50 patients in Europe to start after regulatory sign-off.
    • KVD824: Dosing in Phase 1 study to commence soon. Further update will be made mid-year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharma slips 4% on JPMorgan downgrade

    • Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA -3.6%) is down on lower-than-average volume following a downgrade to Neutral at JPMorgan. Analyst Eric Joseph trimmed his fair value target almost in half to $12 (16% upside) citing the long timelines for key assets.
    • Phase 2 data on M281 in myasthenia gravis, for example, won't be available until 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • LNG

    Cheniere approved by FERC to start production at Corpus Christi Train 2

    • Cheniere Energy (LNG +2.2%) wins permission from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to begin the startup process for the second production unit at its Corpus Christi LNG facility.
    • The introduction of natural gas into the unit allows Cheniere to begin testing and the commissioning process.
    • The first production unit at Cheniere's Port of Corpus Christi facility was brought into service in November with full commercial service expected during Q1, while Train 2 is expected to reach full service during H2.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 4 Comments
  • IRWD

    Ironwood names AstraZeneca exec as CEO; shares up 8%

    • Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD +7.5%) is up on below-average volume following the news that it has hired former AstraZeneca (AZN +2.2%) strategy chief Mark Mallon as its new CEO.
    • He will initially serve as an advisor to the board until the company spins out a new business focused on drugs for rare diseases. At this point, he will take the reins from current CEO Peter Hecht.
    • Update: In a statement, Ironwood confirmed the move, adding that the spinout should be completed in H1.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • TMDI

    Titan Medical builds on Sport Surgical System-stoked up move; shares ahead 28%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Titan Medical (TMDI +28.2%) is up on more than double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 162K shares. The stock has rallied almost 60% since touching $1.07 on December 27, 2018.
    • On Wednesday, it announced that it expects to file a 501(k) application in the U.S. by year-end seeking clearance for its Sport Surgical System. It plans to file for CE Mark certification at the same time. Commercialization should start in 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • BAYRY

    Bayer +6% after judge limits evidence in trial over Roundup cancer claims

    • Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY +5.8%) jumps after a U.S. judge overseeing lawsuits alleging its recently acquired Roundup weedkiller causes cancer issues a ruling that could severely restrict evidence that the plaintiffs consider crucial to their cases.
    • The judge yesterday granted Bayer unit Monsanto’s request to split an upcoming trial into two phases, an order that initially bars plaintiff lawyers from introducing evidence that the company allegedly attempted to influence regulators and manipulate public opinion.
    • The order applies to the case scheduled to go to trial on Feb. 25 and two other bellwether trials which will help determine the range of damages and define settlement options for the rest of the 620 Roundup cases before the judge.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 5 Comments
  • KOOL

    Cesca Therapeutics all in with ThermoGenesis, forms new subsidiary; shares up 25%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Cesca Therapeutics (KOOL +24.7%) is up on average volume on the heels of its announcement that it has acquired the remaining 20% of subsidiary Thermogenesis that it did not own from Bay City Capital (BCC).
    • BCC will have own a 20% stake in a newly created subsidiary of Thermogenesis called CARTXpress Bio that will focus on its CAR-TXpress cellular processing platform.
    • Thermogenesis will focus on the development and commercialization of automated medical devices and technologies for cell therapies, including stem cell banking, point-of-care applications and large-scale manufacturing of immunotherapies like CAR-Ts, leveraging its AutoXpress, POCXpress and CAR-TXpress platforms.

    • Registration trials, Phase 2 studies PIONEER and PATHFINDER, supporting lead candidate avapritinib in advanced and indolent systemic mastocytosis (SM) (rare disorder in which mast cells accumulate in the skin and internal organs) are underway.

  • RARE

    Ultragenyx's DTX401 shows positive action in glycogen storage disease; shares up 4% premarket

    • Ultragenyx Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:RARE) is up 4% premarket, albeit on only 100 shares, following its announcement of preliminary data from a Phase 1/2 trial evaluating gene therapy DTX401 in patients with glycogen storage disease type Ia, an inherited disorder characterized by the build up of sugar (glycogen) in cells leading to impaired organ function.
    • Three patients in the lowest dose cohort all experienced improved glucose control and increased time to hypoglycemia (low blood sugar) during fasting while two experienced clinically meaningful improvements in time to hypoglycemia during a controlled fasting challenge.
    • No infusion-related adverse events and no serious treatment-related adverse events have been reported. All adverse events to date have been mild or moderate.
    • Enrollment is the second cohort will begin this month with interim data expected mid-year.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM

  • Fed boxed in after super-strong employment numbers?

    • Alongside the unexpected 312K jobs added in December, November's originally-reported 155K job gain was revised up to 176K, and October's originally-reported 237K gain was revised up to 274K.
    • The unemployment rate did jump to 3.9% in December from 3.7%, but this is likely due to a higher denominator - the labor force participation rate rose to 63.1% from 62.9%.
    • Average hourly earnings rose 0.4% vs. expectations for 0.3%. On a year-over-year basis, they gained 3.2% vs. 3.0% expected.
    • Average weekly hours were flat at 34.5.
    • The news seemingly puts the Fed in a bit of a box. The central bank is surely shaken by the rout in markets, and might like to pause or end the rate hike cycle, but today's wildly strong data says differently. S&P 500 (NYSEARCA:SPY) futures have given back some gains since the 8:30 ET print, now up just 1%.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is up 4.5 basis points to 2.60%. TLT -0.55% premarket. Gold (NYSEARCA:GLD) is down 0.3%, and the dollar (UUP, UDN) is racing higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 83 Comments

  • MRKR

    Marker Therapeutics up 12% premarket after pipeline update

    • Thinly traded micro cap Marker Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MRKR) is up 12% premarket on light volume following its update on its clinical programs for its MultiTAA T cell therapies. Highlights:
    • Lymphoma: 15 heavily pretreated patients have been treated in a Phase 1/2 study. The disease control rate (responders + stable cancer) is 67% (n=10/15) including six complete responders. No relapses and no cases of cytokine release syndrome have been observed.
    • Four of the six complete responders have remained in remission for 3 - 42 months post-infusion. The average duration of remission is over 26 months.
    • Multiple myeloma: Interim data from a Phase 1/2 trial showed an initial 100% (n=10/10) disease control rate, including one complete responder and two partial responders, but three patients progressed after 3 - 7 months. Four patients continue to have stable cancer.
    • Acute lymphoblastic leukemia: Preliminary Phase 1 data showed a complete response rate of 88% (n=7/8) over 1 - 22 months.
    • Ovarian cancer: Enrollment completed in a Phase 2 trial evaluating TPIV200 as maintenance therapy in patients in their first remission after surgery and platinum-based chemo. Interim data should be available by year-end.
    • Triple-negative breast cancer: Initial data from a dose-finding study of TPIV200 as maintenance therapy following first-line treatment showed a 96% (n=26/27) immune response rate.

  • MAR

    Marriott updates on database breach

    • Marriott International (NYSE:MAR) says it determined that the total number of guest records involved in the database security incident is less than the initial disclosure. The hotel operator also says the number of payment cards and passport numbers involved is a relatively small percentage of the overall total records involved.
    • Marriott has identified approximately 383M records as the upper limit for the total number of guest records that were involved in the incident, down from an early estimate of 500M.  The company has concluded with a fair degree of certainty that information for fewer than 383M unique guests was involved, due to duplicate account records. Marriott also believes that approximately 5.25M unencrypted passport numbers were included in the information accessed by an unauthorized third party. There is no evidence that the unauthorized third party accessed the master encryption key needed to decrypt the encrypted passport numbers.
    • MAR +2.08% premarket to $103.86.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 AM
